alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 14 at 9:59PM CST until further notice by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CST/2 AM EST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Hamilton, Marion, Rhea and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CST /200 AM EST/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 959 PM CST /1059 PM EST/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen since Wednesday morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattanooga, Dayton, Dunlap, Jasper, Pikeville, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Spring City, Walden, Whitwell, Kimball, Monteagle, Fairmount, Graysville, Powells Crossroads, Orme, Palio, Cartwright and Cagle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
